page.title: 03Guides collect the `Flame'
page.content: On Wednesday June 26th 1985, ten of the 3rd Banbury Guides went with Chil our company leader, to the canal moorings at Spiceball Park, Banbury to meet the Rangers who were bringing "The Flame of Friendship" from Oxford. At the canalside were Guides and Brownies from local companies. Whilst they waited, on this overcast evening, for the boat to arrive, each group played their own games. When the boat came into sight everybody cheered and clapped. Chil, who is also District Commissioner went on board to collect the " Flame". With the it she lit the candles on the cakes which each company had brought. When the candles had gone out the cakes were eaten and every one returned home. Chil then had to keep the Â£Flame' alight for three more days. To do this she used a hurricane lamp.
